results.title: They served their country
results.creator_credit: Returned Sailors, Soldiers and Airmens Imperial League of Australia and Audio-Visual Aids, University of Melbourne
results.brief_description: Shows the efforts made by the RSL to keep alive the spirit of comradeship, by serving the needy, sick, and bereaved, providing for the needs of past and present servicemen and women and their dependents. Tours various RSL care facilities in and around Melbourne and Bendigo.

results.title: They reckon a woman's world's just it and a bit
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Penny Chapman and Meg Stewart
results.brief_description: Five housewives, living in a housing estate in outer Adelaide, tell how they organized a mutual self-help group to overcome the boredom, frustration and loneliness of living in suburbia.

results.title: They planted a stone
results.creator_credit: World Wide Pictures, James Carr and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: The story of how the immense desert of the Sudan was transformed, by the harnessing of the waters of the River Nile, into the rich country of the Gezira Cotton Scheme: how this was achieved by means of a partnership with the Sudanese people; and how they have benefited thereby.

results.title: They loved life = Canal = Kanal
results.creator_credit: Zespol Filmowy KADR and Andrzej Wajda
results.brief_description: The second of Wajda’s unplanned war trilogy (with “A generation” and “Ashes and diamond”. A grim depiction of a defeated Poland is the central theme of this moving story of the tragic heroism of a platoon of the underground national army who were loyal to the government in exile of Poland based in London. Based on actual events, this powerful movie shows the Resistance fighters’ descent into the sewers of Warsaw to escape the Nazis during the uprising in 1944; also shown as a psychological descent into the minds of a crushed people; and a times a slow descent into hell, reminiscent of Dante. The extreme situation of their journey through the ‘kanal’ brings out the true values of their characters: their generosity, pettiness, love, courage - and the price they must pay for their faith. This film is a skilful blending of suspense with social realism and poetical vision and, following its release, became instrumental in focusing world attention on the Warsaw uprising, the Polish experience and the arrival of a new national cinema. In Polish with English sub-titles. Winner of the Silver Palm in Cannes (1957) and Gold Medal at the Moscow Film Festival (1957)

results.title: They live again
results.creator_credit: Gaumont-British Instructional and A. Reginald Dobson
results.brief_description: This film (which is a shortened version of the long film “Accident Service”, 312704) deals with the service provided for injured miners in Great Britain, in a modern hospital and rehabilitation centre in the Midlands. All stages of the treatment of their injuries, and their psyhological rehabiliation are vividly presented.

results.title: They live
results.creator_credit: Alive Films, Larry Franco and John Carpenter
results.brief_description: Based on Ray Nelson’s short story “Eight o’clock in the morning”, this is a fantastically subversive film which uses the clever premise that those in control of the global economic power structure are other-worldly aliens. Masquerading as humans they are overpowering the Earth and its inhabitants with an hypnotic form of mind control - hidden subliminal messages in the mass media. Featuring state-of-the-art special effects and starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster, this fast-paced adventure hurtles the viewer into another dimension where all is not as it seems.

results.title: They found their place
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Eric Thompson
results.brief_description: This film deals with the problems of rehabilitation facing disabled ex-servicemen of World War 2, particularly those who have lost a limb. Something of the vocational guidance and the re-training facilities provided for these men is shown in this film.

results.title: They found a cave; Waxworks (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Council for Children's Film and Television, Charles E. Wolnizer and Andrew Steane
results.brief_description: They found a cave: Four English orphans migrate to Tasmania under the care of their Aunt. Their Aunt becomes sick and is hospitalised, leaving the children to seek refuge in a secret cave. Excitement follows the children as they face danger and adventure in the rugged terrain before they are finally reunited with their Aunt. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy. “Waxworks”: A short tale about children lost in a waxworks museum “House of Horrors”.
